page.title: 08Great Barton First School
page.content: The National School for Girls was built in 1840 by Sir Henry Edward Bunbury.His widow had a School for Boys built in 1857 in his memory.The Bunburys main- tained the Schools. The girls were given red cloaks and the boys new boots annually. The girls and infants were in the School La. building and the boys at the School Rd. building until 1918,when the classes were mixed and a Headmaster appointed over the whole School.(School age 5-14) Within living memory the sum- mer(harvest)holidays were lengthened for children to help in the fields.On leaving they became land workers,shop assistants or went into service. During WW2 school meals began to be pro vided and the children had these (from the Central Kitchen-Bury) at the Church Institute. In Sept.1967 a new School was built half way along School Rd.which had 120
